# Cloudflare, Inc. (NET) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Cloudflare, Inc. is an American company headquartered in San Francisco that provides a range of internet services, including content delivery network services, cybersecurity, DDoS mitigation, wide area network services, reverse proxies, Domain Name Service, and ICANN-accredited domain registration. Cloudflare was founded in 2009 by Matthew Prince, Lee Holloway and Michelle Zatlyn, and in 2019 the company went public. Cloudflare stands as a beacon in the cybersecurity and web performance industry, providing an array of services designed to enhance internet security, performance, and reliability for individuals and businesses alike. The company operates on a global scale, offering solutions such as content delivery networks (CDN), DDoS mitigation, secure sockets layer (SSL) encryption, and distributed domain name server services.

Cloudflare is the leading connectivity cloud company. It empowers organizations to make their employees, applications and networks faster and more secure everywhere, while reducing complexity and cost. Cloudflare's connectivity cloud delivers the most full-featured, unified platform of cloud-native products and developer tools, so any organization can gain the control they need to work, develop, and accelerate their business. Powered by one of the world's largest and most interconnected networks, Cloudflare blocks billions of threats online for its customers every day. It is trusted by millions of organizations – from the largest brands to entrepreneurs and small businesses to nonprofits, humanitarian groups, and governments across the globe.

## 2. Current Market Data

Cloudflare stock is priced at $183.30, giving the company a market capitalization of 64.02B. It carries a P/E multiple of -614.59. The Cloudflare 52-week high stock price is 260.00, which is 42.2% above the current share price. The Cloudflare 52-week low stock price is 89.42, which is 51.1% below the current share price. Cloudflare is experiencing fluctuations despite a 79.8% year-to-date gain. The company is set to report earnings of $0.27 per share, marking a 42.11% increase from last year, with analysts maintaining a bullish outlook on its potential in the AI security market.

According to W3Techs, Cloudflare is used by around 19.3% of all websites on the Internet for its web security services, as of January 2025.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

### Core Infrastructure & Security Services
The company provides an integrated cloud-based security solution to secure a range of combination of platforms, including public cloud, private cloud, on-premises, software-as-a-service applications, and Internet of things (IoT) devices; and website and application security products comprising web application firewall, bot management, distributed denial of service protection, API security, SSL/TLS encryption, script management, security center, and rate limiting products. It also offers website and application performance solutions, such as content delivery, load balancing, DNS, agro smart routing, video stream delivery, web optimization, cache reserve, cloudfare waiting room, and cloudfare data localization suite; SASE platform combines network services and Zero Trust security products that provides a cloud-based network-as-a-service; network services, including magic WAN, magic transit, magic firewall, cloudflare network interconnect, and spectrum.

### Zero Trust & Enterprise Solutions
The company provides zero trust security services, including cloudflare access and gateway, remote browser isolation, cloud access security broker, cloud email security, and data loss prevention products. Further, it provides developer-based solutions comprising workers AI, vectorize, AI gateway, cloudflare workers, cloudflare pages, R2 object storage, workers KV, durable objects, D1, hyperdrive, cloudfare stream, cloudfare images, and cloudflare calls; and consumer offerings, such as 1.1.1.1, a DNS resolver, WARP, a virtual private network, and cloudfare registrar that secures registration and management of domain names.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

### AI & Security Innovations
In 2023, Cloudflare launched "Workers AI", a framework allowing for use of Nvidia GPU's within Cloudflare's network. In 2024, Cloudflare launched a tool that prevents bots from scraping websites. In March 2024, they announced Firewall for AI to defend applications running large language models (LLMs).

In March 2025, Cloudflare announced a new feature called "AI Labyrinth", which combats unauthorized "AI" data scraping by serving fake "AI"-generated content to LLM bots.

Cloudflare Workers AI delivers the market's most powerful platform to build and deploy AI applications, with GPUs in more than 190 cities around the world. This allows companies to implement AI solutions efficiently and close to the user, no matter where in the world they are, with security built in.

### New Product Developments
Cloudflare introduced the Cloudforce One threat events platform in March 2025, offering real-time insights into cyberattacks using data gathered from Cloudflare's network.

Pay Per Crawl is introducing enhancements for both AI crawler operators and site owners, focusing on programmatic discovery, flexible pricing models, and granular configuration control. A new authenticated API endpoint allows verified crawlers to programmatically discover domains participating in Pay Per Crawl.

## 5. Growth Strategy

### Platform Expansion & Bundling
Bundling via the Connectivity Cloud aims to raise ARPU and reduce churn by consolidating networking and security vendors; enterprise case studies in 2024–2025 cite vendor consolidation ROI and latency improvements as decisive.

Models for 2025–2026 assume accelerating large‑customer ARR, rising net revenue retention and expanding FCF margins into the teens, supporting long‑term targets of mid‑20s to ~30% growth with durable cash flow. Priority is to expand platform ARPU, sustain best‑in‑class gross margins and convert revenue growth into durable free cash flow while preserving flexibility for expansion and strategic acquisitions.

### International & Channel Expansion
Approximately 51% of Cloudflare's revenue in Q1 2025 was generated outside the United States, reflecting its aggressive global expansion. The company added about 13,105 new paying customers in Q1 2025, reaching a total of approximately 250,819.

In Q1 2025, channel partners contributed 23% of the revenue, up from 19% in Q1 2024, while 77% came from direct customers, down from 81% the previous year, indicating that indirect sales channels are becoming more important.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

### Major Client Categories
The company serves customers in the technology, healthcare, financial services, consumer and retail, industrial, and non-profit industries, as well as government.

Many of today's top AI companies rely on Cloudflare to provide the tools needed to serve up real-time inferences, images, conversations and more–all while ensuring their models and data remain secure.

### Large Customer Growth
We saw record growth in our largest customers, those that spend more than $1 million with Cloudflare per year—closing the year with 173. We added 55 of those customers in 2024, and more than half of these new additions came in during fourth quarter alone.

In a notable Q3 contract, a major AI company signed a $7 million, one-year pool of funds agreement with Cloudflare. Starting as a $500,000 contract, the partnership rapidly expanded as the client adopted Workers AI, achieving nearly double the performance of conventional cloud providers through Cloudflare's pay-per-inference model. Cloudflare secured a $4 million, three-year contract with a satellite internet operator needing FedRAMP-compliant services. This contract highlights Cloudflare's appeal in regulated sectors, enhancing its standing as a reliable aerospace and defense partner. A Fortune 100 company selected Cloudflare for its Zero Trust services in a $4.2 million, two-year contract aimed at enhancing resiliency and security. Additionally, a Global 2000 manufacturing company signed a $2.4 million, three-year contract for Zero Trust, Magic WAN, and Magic Firewall, consolidating its security on Cloudflare's platform.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

### Revenue Growth
Fourth quarter revenue totaled $459.9 million, representing an increase of 27% year-over-year; fiscal year 2024 revenue totaled $1,669.6 million, representing an increase of 29% year-over-year.

In 2024, Cloudflare achieved significant growth, with annual revenue reaching USD 1.67 billion, marking a 29% increase from the previous year. The company expanded its customer base, adding 55 new clients who each spent over USD 1 million annually, bringing the total to 173 such customers by year-end.

### Profitability Metrics
GAAP gross profit was $1,290.9 million, or 77.3% gross margin, compared to $989.7 million, or 76.3%, in fiscal 2023. Non-GAAP gross profit was $1,313.6 million, or 78.7% gross margin, compared to $1,015.8 million, or 78.3%, in fiscal 2023.

Net cash flow from operating activities was $127.3 million, compared to $85.4 million for the fourth quarter of 2023. Free cash flow was $47.8 million, or 10% of total revenue, compared to $50.7 million, or 14% of total revenue, in the fourth quarter of 2023. Cash, cash equivalents, and available-for-sale securities were $1,855.9 million as of December 31, 2024.

## 8. Market Shares

### DDoS Protection & Security Market
As of February 2024, Cloudflare held an impressive 82.16% share of the global DDoS and bot protection software market. This highlights its strong competitive position against rivals in web security.

### Web Security Services
According to W3Techs, Cloudflare is used by around 19.3% of all websites on the Internet for its web security services, as of January 2025.

### Fortune Recognition
Cloudflare was named a Fortune Future 50 company for the second consecutive year, ranking 14th out of the top 50 global companies in 2024.

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

### Primary Competitors
Akamai leads with deep enterprise penetration, large-scale media delivery, and expanding WAAP and DDoS capabilities; competes on scale, long-term relationships, and media workloads. AWS bundles CloudFront with Shield and WAF, leveraging price scale and tight AWS integrations; appeals to customers with AWS data gravity and DevOps toolchains. Fastly competes on low-latency CDN and edge compute (VCL, Compute@Edge) with strong developer affinity and real-time media use cases; performance-centric alternative.

In the cybersecurity arena, Palo Alto Networks is a strong rival, particularly in the SASE market. It reported 36% year-over-year growth in SASE ARR in Q3 fiscal 2025, solidifying its position. Zscaler also presents significant competition in SASE and zero trust markets. Its rapid market expansion and product innovation directly challenge Cloudflare, with a strong presence across various verticals.

### Competitive Positioning
In specific shared markets like API Protection and DDoS Mitigation Solutions, Akamai Technologies shows a higher 'Willingness to Recommend' at 72% compared to Cloudflare's 57%. Similarly, in the Security Service Edge market on Gartner Peer Insights, Zscaler holds a slightly higher rating of 4.6 stars from 1059 reviews versus Cloudflare's 4.5 stars from 280 reviews.

## 10. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

### Recent Acquisitions
Cloudflare announced the acquisition of Kivera, a cloud security, data protection, and compliance platform. The combination of Kivera and the Cloudflare One platform will put preventive controls directly into the cloud deployment process, or 'inline', preventing security issues and risks before they happen to create a cloud journey that is faster, simpler, and more secure.

In May 2024, Cloudflare also acquired BastionZero, a Zero Trust infrastructure access company. This expanded the scope of Cloudflare One's VPN replacement solution beyond apps and networks to infrastructure resources. Together, Kivera and BastionZero help to deliver centralized security management across hybrid IT environments, and provide a modern DevOps-friendly way to help enterprises connect and protect their hybrid infrastructure with Zero Trust best practices.

In November 2025, it was announced Cloudflare had agreed to acquire Replicate, a San Francisco–based platform that enables software developers to run, fine-tune, and deploy open-source machine-learning models via an API without managing infrastructure.

### Strategic Partnerships
Cloudflare places significant emphasis on strategic alliances with Global System Integrators (GSIs) like NTT, and Kyndryl. GSIs are key players in the tech industry, offering extensive technology and business solutions across various sectors worldwide. The value of these partnerships have not only broadened our reach but have also enriched our ecosystem with a range of bespoke service offerings tailored to the nuanced needs of our clients.

Cloudflare and JD Cloud, an intelligent technology service provider and affiliate of JD.com, announced plans for a significant expansion of their partnership, aimed at creating a global platform that empowers developers to deploy, manage, and scale AI inference workloads seamlessly.

## 11. Recent Developments

### AI & Security Leadership
By mid-2025, training drives nearly 80% of AI crawling, while referrals to publishers (especially from Google) are falling. GPTBot and ClaudeBot surged, Amazonbot and Bytespider collapsed, and crawl-to-refer ratios show AI consumes far more than it sends back. Cloudy now supercharges analytics investigations and Cloudforce One threat intelligence! Get instant insights from threat events and APIs on APTs, DDoS, cybercrime & more.

Global Internet traffic ballooned by 19% year-over-year, and we saw substantial changes and advanced capabilities introduced to AI. At the same time, there were major milestones in security: post-quantum encryption now secures 52% of all human traffic to ensure Internet users are protected from future threats. However, this growth also brought challenges, with a dramatic escalation in cyber warfare leading to more than 25 record-breaking DDoS attacks.

### Service & Product Expansion
Cloudflare has incorporated Bot Management and AI Crawl Control in its package of free services for entities in Project Galileo and has committed to train news outlets on new AI tools. These tools will help independent news websites compete in an AI-powered world and empower them to better control how AI services access and use their content. The project now protects 441 state and local government Internet properties.

It blocked on average 165 billion cyber threats per day during the third quarter, including the largest DDoS attack in the world.

## 12. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

### Investment Strengths
- **Strong Financial Performance**: 29% year-over-year revenue growth to $1.67 billion in 2024
- **Market Leadership**: 82.16% market share in DDoS protection and 19.3% of all websites using Cloudflare security services
- **AI Innovation Focus**: GPUs in more than 190 cities for AI applications and comprehensive AI security offerings
- **Large Customer Growth**: 173 customers spending over $1 million annually, adding 55 in 2024
- **Strong Cash Position**: $1.85 billion in cash and equivalents

### Key Risks
- **Intense Competition**: Facing pressure from hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, Google) and specialized security vendors (Zscaler, Palo Alto Networks)
- **Valuation Concerns**: High P/E multiple and recent stock volatility despite strong growth
- **Execution Risk**: Need to successfully integrate recent acquisitions and maintain growth momentum

### Rating: 7.5/10 (Strong Buy)

**Rationale**: Cloudflare demonstrates exceptional execution with 29% revenue growth, strong market positioning in critical AI and security segments, and robust cash generation. The company's comprehensive platform approach and AI-first strategy position it well for continued growth in the expanding cybersecurity and edge computing markets.

**Fair Value Estimate: $220-240**

Based on Cloudflare's strong fundamentals, market leadership position, AI growth opportunities, and sustained revenue growth trajectory of 25-30%, a fair value range of $220-240 per share appears reasonable for investors with moderate risk appetite seeking growth exposure to the AI security and edge computing megatrends. This represents approximately 20-30% upside from current levels, justified by the company's execution track record and expanding addressable market opportunities.
